rows.text_1:
Taking care of yourself 

We often don’t look after ourselves enough. But this is so important, especially as a parent!

Reducing our stress and treating ourselves well helps us AND our children.
rows.media_title: How will it help me and my family?
rows.media_transcript:
Greetings, everyone.

There are times when we experience challenges, face problems, and do not know what to do. It is important to take care of ourselves every day, so we are ready to handle those times well and stay calm. 

When we are calm, we are in a good state to think positively and come up with positive solutions to any challenges we may be facing.

rows.text_1: Let’s look at how a mother manages to take care of herself when life gets a bit too much.

rows.text_2:
{F1_DAUGHTER_6} : “{F1_MOTHER}, come and play with me with my dolls!” 

 {F1_MOTHER}  *(thinking)*: “I am feeling so stressed. Let me take a deep breath... Phewww… Maybe I can finish cooking and then take a few minutes to play with {F1_DAUGHTER_3}. It will take my mind off all these worries.”

{F1_MOTHER} : “Allright, {F1_DAUGHTER_3}, let me finish dinner quickly, and then I will come play with you.” 

 {F1_DAUGHTER_6} : “Okay, {F1_MOTHER}.”
{F1_MOTHER}  *(thinking)*: “I am glad I took some time with my child. I feel a bit better and my mind feels clearer already. After dinner, I deserve a cup of tea by myself.”
{F1_MOTHER}  *(thinking)*: “What a day. I have a lot on my plate, but I am still standing and trying my best every day. Tomorrow, I will chat with my friend. I know I am not alone in this.”

rows.text_1: {F1_MOTHER} did a few things that can also help us when we are feeling overwhelmed.

rows.quiz_2_feedback_1: Yes, taking a pause helps in stressful moments. Even taking a few deep breaths can help us feel better and respond more calmly.
rows.quiz_2_feedback_2: Exactly. Play helped {F1_MOTHER} to connect with {F1_DAUGHTER_6} and forget about her worries for a moment.
rows.quiz_2_feedback_3: That’s right! {F1_MOTHER} recognises she is trying her best in difficult circumstances.
rows.quiz_2_feedback_4: Exactly, {F1_MOTHER} creates a moment in the evening to enjoy a cup of tea by herself. Having this moment also helps her to come up with other ways to get support.

rows.quiz_3_feedback_1: Exactly! She is able to feel calmer for a moment and think more positively.

rows.section_1_title:
PAUSE  

Taking a pause helps us to feel and respond calmer in stressful moments.
rows.section_1_button_text:
Even taking a few deep breaths makes a big difference. 

By staying calm instead of reacting strongly, you can also prevent a lot of problems!
rows.section_2_text:
PRAISE 

Take a moment and think of one thing YOU did well recently. Say it aloud if you can: "Well done for …"
rows.section_2_extra_text:
Being a parent can be hard. Praise yourself for trying your best. 

Identify negative thoughts when they start and decide if they are true or helpful. If not, find positive thoughts to replace them with. 

For example, instead of “I am a bad parent” say “I am feeling overwhelmed right now, but I am doing the best I can and I will talk to a friend for support”.
rows.section_3_text:
REWARD 

What makes you happy? Find small things that you can do every day to care for yourself.
rows.section_3_extra_text: Doing something you enjoy will give you a short break. It will help you to think more clearly and care better for your family. Caring for yourself = caring your family!

rows.text_1:
Whenever you can, pause, praise and reward yourself. And remember to connect with your family and friends - you are not alone.

Care for yourself every day. You matter!
rows.media_title: How it helped a parent like you:
rows.media_transcript:
For me as a parent, it was almost impossible to find time for myself. I was always busy taking care of everyone else. Through ParentApp, I realised how important it is to take care of myself. It helps me AND my family! 

Having a moment for myself helps me to breathe and notice how I feel. Even five minutes to have a cup of tea makes a big difference. Now I can deal with my stress better.
